title: Big Plays: Xerath saves the day

replies.body: Minion MVP https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jNz4d4atn40 #WORLDSBIGPLAYS
minion, you da real mvp
**MVP MVP MVP MVP** {{item:3060}}
Report minions for penta ks.
Report Xerath for KSing minions.

> Report minions for penta ks.

well it wouldnt really be a ks if you were the last one to hit the person
@IJellyH, think about what you just said.
Teamwork guys, not solo glory :(
Yeah, show some videos of teamwork op-ness.  It's what you guys are always talking about.
Exactly something that show great collaboration or team fight tactics.

Last time they did that it was Nami making a play in a teamfight with the help of a Jarvan, and everyone complained for weeks about how "Oh anyone can do that" So they instead started doing things like Cheese Pentakills by Katarinas because people like that more for some reason. Cause Solo glory makes people feel good.
Watch high elo korean teams

Amen.  Very few impressive plays, more of a culmination of why you don't do certain things.

The Leona tower dive however, where she keeps perfect placement, auto levels and uses her ultimate perfectly and has the wisdom to go for the kill onto the Thresh in the first place to get that experience to be able to level.

That is a play, I want to desperately see more of.  A mix of strategic precision combined with mechanical forte, all from a vulnerable position.

They still lost.

You could say he only saved the day. {{champion:131}}
No they won. i looked it up
I'm not the best in the world, but I think my save was a bit better... https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IiqigR6uHpQ
that was actually really awesome sauce
Such trash talk after that, oh god that was great.
Gotta love randoms, heh.

I'm sorry but I don't see the play here they didn't even bother  {{champion:101}} and they were just focusing the nexus which allowed  him to take them down with his range the only person who even hit him was a no damage tank {{champion:412}}  no offense I <3 thresh favorite support who was the only one left and by the time they got to the nexus most was half health sorry riot but maybe you should go out and find plays sometimes if your not getting much good ones sent in.

It's a "BIG PLAY" because {{champion:101}} , whether he meant to or not, so seamlessly used his abilities to force the enemy team away from the Nexus, staggering the amount of damage they could do as they moved away from his assaults and allowing for time to set up the plays that unfolded.

I agree with everything you said except about riot going out and finding plays. Riot can't actually find plays because they're busy designing champions,  making the servers better, etc. If they went out to find plays, everything would just be slowed down. I'd rather have new champions and alot of other stuff rather than seeing a big play.

The only reason why I put that part in was cause I was basing It off what someone said from the last "big play" that people send in plays and they might not get good ones. As for anyone wondering why I don't like these recent "big plays" is cause I wanna see a full out brawl with just having one person come out alive and actually do some cool moves you know, show me something neat like the leona under her tower landing that last ult so nicely was cool. I wanna see more of that. Sorry if I offended anyone. Only luv <3
designing champions like making Soraka a shitty parasitic clone .... yeah they are working REALLY hard, on fucking it up
This will surely get downvoted for being a hater but...I actually totally agree with you.  It was a nice play, but Jinx didn't eve try to dodge!
{{champion:412}}  FEEL THE WRATH OF  MY AUTOS XERATH!!!
Why didnt the Jinx just attack and move, attack and move,
I mean, that was kinda cool and all, but he really just looked hella fed.
All of the sudden, I want to play Xerath
I used to play Xerath mid a lot. He was by far my best mid champ, but damn, this guy puts me to shame.
Orianna saves lives [ayyy](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bkN8rGWVZqc)

Even though this was cool, she did not once save a single one of her teammates' lives. In fact, she ran off as they began to die, letting the enemy feed and then chase after her, which led to her taking all the glory of killing the enemy team instead of doing it as a full team. This could get featured as a big plays spotlight, but not under the guise of her "saving lives"...

Would it have been a better choice to run in and die for nothing, instead?
No, the clear option here was to let dead teammates die and salvage the game by systematically dismantling the enemy team afterwards, by playing off of their greed.
So, yes, the Orianna did save lives, because that would've been an easy 1v4 push to nexus.
OMG{{champion:201}} {{item:3301}}
Stahp wasting my time riot.
Reminds me of the last of my 10 ranked matches in LAN, when my team had 3 afks and i hold 35 minutes with Xerath being supported by Soraka, until we finally lose :P
Not one Thresh Hook was thrown that day
Another astonishing point-and-click adventure by Riot Games
REWATCH THIS!   Jinx doesn't even try to dodge the skill shots she just takes it to the face like a LOSER ... big plays more like big throws
How does it end!?!?!

Again, another great demonstration of skill, ability and keeping a cool head in an awful situation. STILL not what big plays are about, TEAMWORK is a PLAY, this is just Xerath getting a quadra. It seems like in the same way that Rito just makes updates that favor competition and "viability of champions" in competitions, that is also their stance in what a PLAY is, just one persons glory not a TEAM working as a whole.
whoa o_o
all thresh really had to do was land one hook and jinx would of finished or jinx could of orbwalked a bit, either way nice quad.

I think he was trying to, but the minions who just spawned blocked the path of the hook, so he couldn't do it. It looked to me like he was trying to find a gap in between them, but by the time he could he was the last person on the team left.

{{champion:101}} needs a buff 
his to hard ohhh
I did that in a provisional once but I don't think it counts cuz it was a provisional and people in my range usually suck.
The ass is inevitable

This, Gnar's play and Yasuo's. "Welcome to the Big Plays Spotlight! In this feature, we highlight the most epic plays, from meticulously-coordinated early tower dives to mind-blowing cross-map jukes."  I just don't feel these plays are so amazing that they need to be featured on the website.  My opinion whether you agree or disagree
